org.cleverbus.core.common.ws.transport.http
Class CloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.ws.transport.http.AbstractHttpWebServiceMessageSender
      org.springframework.ws.transport.http.HttpComponentsMessageSender
          org.cleverbus.core.common.ws.transport.http.CloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender
All Implemented Interfaces:
DisposableBean, InitializingBean, WebServiceMessageSender
Direct Known Subclasses:
NtlmCloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender
public class CloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender
extends HttpComponentsMessageSender

WebServiceMessageSender implementation that uses Apache HttpClient (CloseableHttpClient) to execute POST requests.

Allows to use a pre-configured HttpClient instance, potentially with authentication, HTTP connection pooling, etc. Authentication can also be set by injecting a Credentials instance (such as the UsernamePasswordCredentials). Out of box contains CloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender.RemoveSoapHeadersInterceptor.

Author:
Tomas Hanus
See Also:
HttpClient, CloseableHttpClient, PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager, UsernamePasswordCredentials

Nested Class Summary

          HttpClient HttpRequestInterceptor implementation that configures the Apache Http Client for preemptive authentication.
static class CloseableHttpComponentsMessageSender.RemoveSoapHeadersInterceptor
          HttpClient HttpRequestInterceptor implementation that removes Content-Length and Transfer-Encoding headers from the request.

setMaxConnectionsPerHost

public void setMaxConnectionsPerHost(Map<String,String> maxConnectionsPerHost)
                              throws URISyntaxException
Sets the maximum number of connections per host for the underlying HttpClient. The maximum number of connections per host can be set in a form accepted by the java.util.Properties class, like as follows: 

 https://esb.cleverbus.org/esb/=1
 http://esb.cleverbus.org:8080/esb/=7
 http://esb.cleverbus.org/esb/=10

The host can be specified as a URI (with scheme and port).

Overrides:
setMaxConnectionsPerHost in class HttpComponentsMessageSender
Parameters:
maxConnectionsPerHost - a properties object specifying the maximum number of connection
Throws:
URISyntaxException
See Also:
PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.setMaxPerRoute(org.apache.http.conn.routing.HttpRoute, int)

setAuthScope

public void setAuthScope(org.apache.http.auth.AuthScope authScope)
Sets the authentication scope to be used. Only used when the credentials property has been set.

By default, the AuthScope.ANY is used.

Overrides:
setAuthScope in class HttpComponentsMessageSender
